It comes with useful methods for Arrays (clone, merge, applyToDefaults), Objects (removeKeys, copy), Asserting and more. For example, to use Hoek to set configuration with default options: ```javascript var Hoek = require('hoek'); var default = {url : "www.github.com", port : "8000", debug : true} var config = Hoek.applyToDefaults(default, {port : "3000", admin : true}); // In this case, config would be { url: 'www.github.com', port: '3000', debug: true, admin: true } ``` Under each of the sections (such as Array), there are subsections which correspond to Hoek methods. Each subsection will explain how to use the corresponding method. In each js excerpt below, the var Hoek = require('hoek') is omitted for brevity. ## Object Hoek provides several helpful methods for objects and arrays. ### clone(obj) This method is used to clone an object or an array.
